title: durop77
author: durop77
content: A conversation took place with a man we haven't seen since graduation, he is successful, has a car, a house, a wife. I understand that it is already closer to 40 years, as a child it was not easy for us, how are you doing? Have you reached heights by the middle of your life or are you still in the process?

comments.author: koleusdat
comments.body: I didn't achieve anything, unfortunately I went the wrong way, so I lost time and opportunities.

comments.author: tbe2077
comments.body: It's a vague question. But I would say I belong in the 96's club. I have a house (on a mortgage of course) and a decent-paying job. But still single, the thought of starting a marriage and family increases the financial pressure 100x. So that's what I would say about that. I want to hear more about 90's babies about what are your progress in life right now.

comments.author: koleusdat
comments.body: Most of those born at this time became the middle stratum of the population. There were few opportunities to study, and only a few got out into a rich environment. And then most of them are thanks to good relatives. Success is determined by everyone in different ways.

comments.author: cute nmp
comments.body: Born in the early 1990's, spent most of my times in school though I am successful in school financially I am nowhere near success. Trying my best now to improve my financial situation.
